4.verse: He made a grating for the altar, a network of bronze. He placed it under the edge of the altar so that the net hung halfway down the altar.

5.verse: He made four rings of bronze and placed them at the four corners of the bronze grating so that poles could be inserted.

6.verse: He made poles out of acacia wood and covered them with bronze.

7.verse: He placed the poles through the rings on the sides of the altar so it could be carried. He made the altar out of boards, hollow in the middle.

8.verse: The Basin for Washing. -He made the basin of bronze and its base of bronze from the mirrors of the women who ministered at the door to the meeting tent.

9.verse: The Courtyard. -He made the courtyard. On the south side of the courtyard there was a drape of fine twisted linen, one hundred cubits long.

10.verse: There were twenty columns with twenty bronze bases. The hooks of the pillars and their rings were made out of silver.

11.verse: Likewise on the north side there was a drape one hundred cubits long. There were twenty columns with twenty bronze bases. The hooks of the pillars and their rings were made out of silver.

12.verse: On the west side there were fifty cubits of drapes with ten columns and ten bases. The hooks of the pillars and their rings were made out of silver.

13.verse: On the east side there were fifty cubits.

14.verse: There was fifteen cubits of draping with three columns and three bases on one side.

15.verse: On the other side of the entrance to the courtyard, there was fifteen cubits of draping with three columns and three bases.

16.verse: All of the drapes that formed the courtyard were made of fine twisted linen.

17.verse: The bases of the columns were made out of bronze. The hooks of the columns and the rings were made out of silver. The overlaying of their capitals and the columns of the courtyard were filleted with silver.

18.verse: The screen for the entrance to the courtyard was made of needlework of blue, purple, and scarlet cloth and fine twisted linen. It was twenty cubits long and five cubits high, that is, wide, like the drapes of the courtyard.

19.verse: It had four columns with their four bases out of bronze. Their hooks and the overlaying of their capitals and their bars were made out of silver.

20.verse: All the pegs of the tabernacle and of the surrounding courtyard were made out of bronze.

21.verse: The Materials Used. -These are the expenses for the tabernacle, the dwelling place of the Testimony, that Moses ordered the Levites to calculate under the direction of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.

22.verse: Bezalel, the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, completed what the Lord had commanded Moses to do.

23.verse: He did this together with Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, who was an engraver and a skillful craftsman, and a weaver of blue, purple, and scarlet cloth and fine twisted linen.

24.verse: All the gold that was used in the work—that is, for all the work of the sanctuary, which was the gold from the offering—was twenty-nine talents and seven hundred and thirty shekels, measured by the shekel of the sanctuary.

25.verse: The silver of the assembly was measured to be one hundred talents and one thousand seven hundred and seventy-five shekels, measured by the shekel of the sanctuary.

26.verse: Every person who was counted in the census twenty years old and up gave a bekah, which is worth a half-shekel according to the measure of the sanctuary. There were six hundred and three thousand, five hundred and fifty men.

27.verse: The one hundred talents were used to make the bases of the sanctuary and the bases for the veil. One hundred talents were used for the one hundred bases, or one talent for each base.

28.verse: The one thousand seven hundred and seventy-five shekels were used for the hooks for the pillars, and for overlaying and filleting their tops.

29.verse: The bronze presented in the offering amounted to seventy talents and two thousand four hundred shekels.

30.verse: With it were made the bases for the entrance to the meeting tent, the altar of bronze with the netting of bronze, and all the accessories for the altar,

31.verse: the bases for the courtyard, the bases for the gate to the courtyard, and all the pegs of the tabernacle and all the pegs of the surrounding courtyard.

1.verse: Chapter 39 -The Priestly Vestments. -With the blue, purple, and scarlet cloth were made the finely woven vestments for ministering in the sanctuary, as well as the sacred vestments for Aaron as the Lord had commanded Moses.

2.verse: The Ephod. -He made the ephod of gold and blue, purple, and scarlet cloth and fine twisted linen.

3.verse: The gold was beaten into fine plates and cut into wires and was interwoven into the blue, purple, and scarlet cloth and the linen with skilled craftsmanship.

4.verse: Two shoulder pieces were made for the ephod that were attached to its two ends so that it might be joined together.

5.verse: The skillfully woven band to bind it together that was placed over it was of the same workmanship and the same materials, of gold, blue, purple, and scarlet cloth and twisted linen, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

6.verse: The onyx stones were prepared and set into settings of gold filigree. They were engraved with the names of the children of Israel, like an engraver engraves a signet ring.

7.verse: The two stones were set on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as stones of remembrance for the children of Israel, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

8.verse: The Breastplate. -He made the breastplate like the ephod, with fine workmanship. It was made of gold, blue, purple and scarlet cloth and fine twisted linen.

9.verse: It was square and doubled over, a span in length and a span in width.

10.verse: They covered it with settings of precious stones arranged in four rows. The first row had a ruby, a topaz, and an emerald.

11.verse: The second row had a turquoise, a sapphire, and a diamond.

12.verse: The third row had a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst.

13.verse: The fourth row had a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. They were set in gold filigree settings.

14.verse: The stones corresponded to the names of the children of Israel. There were twelve, standing for their names. They were engraved like the engraving of a signet ring, each name corresponding to a name of one of the twelve tribes.

15.verse: They made chains of pure gold on the breastplate in the shape of twisted cords.

16.verse: They also made two filigree settings of gold and two golden rings and placed the two rings at the two edges of the breastplate.

17.verse: They attached the two golden chains to the two rings at the edges of the breastplate.

18.verse: They attached the other ends of the chains to the two filigree settings and they thus attached it to the front part of the shoulder pieces of the ephod.

19.verse: They made two other golden rings and placed them on the two edges of the breastplate, on its inside edge, next to the ephod.

20.verse: They made two other golden rings and placed them on the two shoulder pieces of the ephod, at their bottom on the front side, next to the place where it is attached to the skillfully woven band of the ephod.

21.verse: Other Priestly Vestments. -They then tied the breastplate with its rings to the rings of the ephod with a cord of blue material so that it might lie upon the skillfully woven band of the ephod and that the breastplate might not pull away from the ephod, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

22.verse: The Robe. -He made a robe of the ephod all in blue

23.verse: with an opening in the middle and a woven border around the opening so that it might not be torn.

24.verse: They made a design of pomegranates on the hem of the garment with blue, purple, and scarlet cloth and fine twisted linen.

25.verse: They also made bells out of pure gold and placed the bells in between the pomegranates all around the hem of the robe.

26.verse: There was a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, around the hem of the robe used for ministering, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

27.verse: Other Vestments. -They also wove tunics from fine linen for Aaron and his sons,

28.verse: a turban of fine linen, caps of fine linen, and undergarments of fine twisted linen,

29.verse: and a sash of fine twisted linen, of blue, purple, and scarlet cloth, embroidered with fine needlework, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

30.verse: The Turban. -They made the plate of the holy crown out of pure gold and they wrote on it as an engraver would engrave a signet ring, “Holy to the Lord.”

31.verse: They attached it with a blue cord to the front part of the turban, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

32.verse: Moses Inspects the Tabernacle. -Thus, all of the work of the tabernacle, of the tent of meeting, was finished. The children of Israel had done everything just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

33.verse: They then brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent and all its accessories, its clasps, boards, bars, columns, and bases,

34.verse: the covering of rams’ skins dyed red, the covering of sheep skins, the veil of the screen;

35.verse: the Ark of Testimony with its poles, and the seat of atonement,

36.verse: the table with all its accessories and the bread of the Presence,

37.verse: the lampstand made of pure gold with its lamps, that is, the lamps that were to be placed on top of it, with all its accessories, the oil for light,

38.verse: the altar of gold, the oil of anointing, the fragrant incense; the screen for the entrance to the tent,

39.verse: the altar of bronze with its bronze grating, its poles and all its accessories, the basin and its base,

40.verse: the drapes for the courtyard, their columns, their bases, and the screen for the gate to the courtyard, their cords, their pegs, and all the utensils for ministering in the tabernacle, for the meeting tent;

41.verse: the finely woven vestments for ministering in the sanctuary, the holy vestments for Aaron the priest, and the vestments for his sons in their priestly ministry.

42.verse: Whatever the Lord had commanded Moses, this is how the children of Israel did all their work.

43.verse: Moses examined all the work, and behold, it was done as the Lord had commanded. So Moses blessed them.

1.verse: Chapter 40 -God Commands Moses To Consecrate the Tabernacle and the Priests. -Then the Lord spoke to Moses and said to him,

2.verse: “On the first day of the first month you shall set up the tabernacle, the meeting tent.

3.verse: Put the Ark of Testimony inside, and in front of the Ark hang the veil.

4.verse: Bring in the table and arrange its accessories. Then bring in the lampstand and put on its lamps.

5.verse: Place the altar of gold for incense before the Ark of Testimony and set up the screen at the entrance to the tent.

6.verse: “Set the altar of burnt offerings in front of the entrance to the tabernacle, the meeting tent.

7.verse: Place the basin between the meeting tent and the altar, and pour water into it.

8.verse: Set up the courtyard all around, and put up the screen for the entrance to the courtyard.

9.verse: “Take the oil of anointing and anoint the tabernacle and everything in it. Consecrate it and all its furnishings, and it will become holy.

10.verse: Also anoint the altar of burnt offerings and all its accessories. Consecrate the altar, and it will become most holy.

11.verse: Also anoint the basin and its base and consecrate them.

12.verse: “Then have Aaron and his sons approach the entrance to the meeting tent and wash them with water.

13.verse: Put the holy vestments on Aaron and anoint him and consecrate him so that he might serve me as a priest.

14.verse: Also have his sons approach and put their tunics on them.

15.verse: Anoint them, like their father, so that they might exercise my priesthood. In this way their anointing will confer upon them an eternal priesthood, for all their generations.”

16.verse: Moses Carries Out the Orders Received from God. -Moses did everything as the Lord had commanded him.

17.verse: Thus, in the second year, the first day of the first month, the tabernacle was set up.

18.verse: Moses erected the tabernacle. He laid its bases and set up its boards. He fixed the bars and raised the columns.

19.verse: He then extended the tent over the tabernacle and over that he placed the covering for the tent, just as the Lord had commanded him.

20.verse: He took the Testimony and placed it inside the Ark. He attached the poles to the Ark and put the seat of atonement on the Ark.

21.verse: He then placed the Ark in the tabernacle, setting up the veil as a screen and hanging it in front of the Testimony, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

22.verse: Moses placed the table in the meeting tent, on the north side of the tabernacle, outside the veil.

23.verse: He set up rows of bread upon it before the Lord, just as the Lord had commanded him.

24.verse: He set up the lampstand in the meeting tent, opposite the table, on the south side of the tabernacle.

25.verse: He placed the lamps on it before the Lord, just as the Lord had commanded him.

26.verse: Moses then placed the golden altar in the meeting tent, in front of the veil,

27.verse: and he burned fragrant incense upon it, just as the Lord had commanded him.

28.verse: He placed the screen at the entrance to the tabernacle.

29.verse: He then placed the altar of burnt offering at the entrance to the tabernacle, the meeting tent, and he offered burnt offerings and grain offerings upon it, just as the Lord had commanded him.

30.verse: He placed the basin between the meeting tent and the altar and he put water in it for ablutions.

31.verse: Moses, Aaron, and his sons then washed their hands and their feet with it.

32.verse: Whenever they entered the meeting tent and approached the altar, they washed themselves, as the Lord had commanded Moses.

33.verse: Finally, Moses erected the courtyard around the tabernacle and the altar and put up the screen to the entrance of the courtyard. Thus Moses finished the work.

34.verse: The Glory of God Fills the Tabernacle. -Then a cloud covered the tent and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.

35.verse: Moses could not enter the meeting tent, for the cloud had settled upon it and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.

36.verse: The Guiding Cloud. -Throughout their journeys, whenever the cloud would be taken up and leave the tabernacle, the children of Israel would break camp.

37.verse: If the cloud did not go up, they did not leave until it had gone up.

38.verse: Throughout their journeys the cloud of the Lord remained in the tabernacle during the day, and during the night there was a fire in it, visible to all the households of Israel.
